p: EU information thresholds have been established as hourly ozone concentrations ‘beyond which there is a risk to human health from brief exposure for particularly sensitive sections of the population’, and about which the public must be informed ( European Council Directive 2008/50/EC). The following maximum daily 1-h average exposure index focuses on the higher values and is useful for comparing health-relevant ozone at a site with the EU ‘information threshold’, set at 180 μg m –3 (90 ppb). The directive also has an alert threshold of 240 μg/m 3 (120 ppb).
